meanings.sent1: The grass in the field was the dewiest in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The flowers looked their dewiest after the rain shower.
meanings.sent3: The dewiest leaves seemed to sparkle like tiny diamonds in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were the dewiest, reflecting the beauty of the nature around her.
meanings.sent5: The dewiest meadow glistened under the early morning sun.

meanings.sent1: It was the dewiest morning of the entire summer.
meanings.sent2: The dewiest petals of the rose caught the first light of dawn.
meanings.sent3: The dewiest grass made the perfect bed for a tiny fairy to rest.
meanings.sent4: His smile was the dewiest, radiating pure happiness.
meanings.sent5: The dewiest clouds floated lazily across the sky, like cotton candy.
